Q1.text: Calculate the magnitude of the magnetic field at a distance of 10 cm from a long straight wire carrying 20 A.

Q2.text: A circular loop of radius 15 cm carries 5 A. Determine the magnetic field at the center.

Q3.text: Compute the magnetic field inside a 50 cm long solenoid with 500 turns carrying 2 A.

Q4a.text: A proton moves at 1e6 m/s perpendicularly into a 200 μT magnetic field. Calculate the radius of its circular path.

Q5a.text: Pb²⁺ ion passes 5 cm from a long wire carrying 10 A. Calculate the magnetic field at its location.

Q5b.text: Determine the magnitude of the force on a Pb²⁺ ion moving at 200 m/s near a wire producing a 4e-5 T magnetic field.

Q6a.text: Two parallel wires 3 cm apart carry 8 A and 12 A. Compute the force on a 30 cm segment.

Q6b.text: Are the forces between the wires attractive or repulsive?

Q7b.text: Determine the net magnetic field at the center of a solenoid and ring carrying opposite-direction currents.

Q8.text: A 0.5 m wire with 6 A in a 100 μT B field (into page). Find the magnetic force magnitude.

Q9a.text: What current is needed in a 250-turn, 0.5 m solenoid to produce 40 μT field?

Q9b.text: What current is needed in a 0.2 m radius ring to produce 40 μT field at center?

Q10a.text: Estimate the solenoid’s B-field and field at 1 cm from the straight wire (5 A).

Q10b.text: Calculate force per unit length on a wire (5 A) in solenoid’s B-field (1.26e-3 T).
